2022-08-01.name: National Balloon Classic
2022-08-01.summary: This giant hot-air balloon festival includes daily flights, rides for the public, music, night glows and closing fireworks.

2022-08-01.name: Coast Guard Festival
2022-08-01.summary: There's nightly entertainment on the waterfront, a downtown carnival, tours of Coast Guard cutters, a Grand Parade and fireworks.

2022-08-01.name: Folklorama
2022-08-01.summary: This Manitoba prairie town celebrates its heritage with pavilions representing 44 nationalities, offering             music, dance and food at many venues.

2022-08-01.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-08-01.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-08-03.name: Lake Bemidji Dragon Boat Festival
2022-08-03.summary: In addition to boat races, there will be kids' activities, cultural performances, music and a parade of teams.

2022-08-04.summary: This Manitoba prairie town celebrates its heritage with pavilions representing 44 nationalities, offering             music, dance and food at many venues.

Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2022-08-04.name: Lake Bemidji Dragon Boat Festival
2022-08-04.summary: In addition to boat races, there will be kids' activities, cultural performances, music and a parade of teams.

2022-08-04.name: Wisconsin State Fair
2022-08-04.summary: The fair in this Milwaukee suburb features big-name musicians, a sea-lion show, a daily parade and lots of contests, including hog-calling, cookie-stacking and             cream puff-eating.

2022-08-04.name: Fisherman's Picnic
2022-08-04.summary: There's a lot going on at the North Shore's biggest festival, including             loon-calling, log-rolling, herring-eating and rock-skipping contests; Saturday fireworks; and the grand parade on Sunday.

2022-08-04.name: Bix Beiderbecke Memorial Jazz Festival
2022-08-04.summary: Since 1972, fans of this Jazz Age cornetist and composer have held this             festival in his hometown on the Mississippi.

2022-08-04.name: WE Fest
2022-08-04.summary: Jason Aldean, Miranda Lambert and Luke Bryan are among the headliners at this big country festival in west-central Minnesota.

2022-08-04.name: Mile of Music
2022-08-04.summary: More than 180 singer-songwriters perform at more than 40 venues along College Avenue downtown.

2022-08-04.name: Festival of Sail
2022-08-04.summary: This tall-ships festival is the only Minnesota stop on the triannual Tall Ships Challenge sail-training tour. In addition to ship tours, there will be day sails and family entertainment.

2022-08-04.name: Blues on the Chippewa
2022-08-04.summary: Just up the Chippewa River from Lake Pepin, this free blues festival in Memorial Park features 16 bands.

2022-08-05.name: National Balloon Classic
2022-08-05.summary: This giant hot-air balloon festival includes daily flights, rides for the public, music, night glows and closing fireworks.

2022-08-05.name: Coast Guard Festival

This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-08-05.summary: There are chainsaw artists and alligator shows as well as a  carnival and grandstand acts that include national country musicians.

2022-08-05.name: Lake Bemidji Dragon Boat Festival
2022-08-05.summary: In addition to boat races, there will be kids' activities, cultural performances, music and a parade of teams.

2022-08-05.summary: The fair in this Milwaukee suburb features big-name musicians, a sea-lion show, a daily parade and lots of contests, including hog-calling, cookie-stacking and             cream puff-eating.

2022-08-05.name: Fisherman's Picnic
2022-08-05.summary: There's a lot going on at the North Shore's biggest festival, including             loon-calling, log-rolling, herring-eating and rock-skipping contests; Saturday fireworks; and the grand parade on Sunday.

2022-08-05.name: Bix Beiderbecke Memorial Jazz Festival
2022-08-05.summary: Since 1972, fans of this Jazz Age cornetist and composer have held this             festival in his hometown on the Mississippi.

2022-08-05.name: WE Fest
2022-08-05.summary: Jason Aldean, Miranda Lambert and Luke Bryan are among the headliners at this big country festival in west-central Minnesota.

2022-08-05.name: Mile of Music
2022-08-05.summary: More than 180 singer-songwriters perform at more than 40 venues along College Avenue downtown.

2022-08-05.name: Festival of Sail
2022-08-05.summary: This tall-ships festival is the only Minnesota stop on the triannual Tall Ships Challenge sail-training tour. In addition to ship tours, there will be day sails and family entertainment.

2022-08-05.name: Pufferbilly Days
2022-08-05.summary: This festival in central Iowa, just west of Ames, is named for a steam engine and features a spike-driving contest, mud volleyball and rides on the Boone and Scenic Valley Railroad. A parade is Saturday.

2022-08-05.name: Brat Days
2022-08-05.summary: This town on Lake Michigan is sausage central. There's music, a carnival, beer and, of course, a brat-eating             contest. The parade is Saturday.

2022-08-05.name: Uptown Art Fair
2022-08-05.summary: This large juried art fair in the Uptown neighborhood draws crowds. Use a Nice Ride bike or download a free bus/train pass to avoid congestion.

2022-08-05.name: Live From the Rock
2022-08-05.summary: This folk festival is on the shores of Lake Superior, east of Thunder Bay near Nipigon. Camping is on-site.

2022-08-05.name: Festa Italiana
2022-08-05.summary: This festival at the Naper Settlement is a showcase for Italian culture, food, music and artisans and has two entertainment stages.

2022-08-05.name: Pie Day
2022-08-05.summary: Minnesota's official Pie Capital near Cambridge holds pie-eating contests, a pie trivia contest and performances of the             Pie-Alleuia Chorus.

2022-08-05.name: Buffalo Bill Days
2022-08-05.summary: Ride the Root River State Trail, then enjoy music, kids' games, sports tournaments, fireworks and a parade on Sunday.

2022-08-05.name: River City Days
2022-08-05.summary: In this Mississippi River town, there's music, food and games in Bay Point Park and an arts show in Levee Park. The parade is at 1 p.m. Sunday.

2022-08-05.name: Blues on the Chippewa
2022-08-05.summary: Just up the Chippewa River from Lake Pepin, this free blues festival in Memorial Park features 16 bands.

2022-08-05.name: Tall Timber Days
2022-08-05.summary: In this longtime logging town, there will be lumberjack shows, chainsaw carving, music and a parade Sunday.

2022-08-05.name: Cache Ba$h
2022-08-05.summary: This town north of Milwaukee calls itself the Geocache Capital of the Midwest. For the festival, it hides 50 new caches and gives away $1,000 in cash prizes.

2022-08-11.summary: This Manitoba prairie town celebrates its heritage with pavilions representing 44 nationalities, offering             music, dance and food at many venues.

2022-08-11.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-08-11.name: Iowa State Fair
2022-08-11.summary: See a diaper derby, outhouse races and mullet contest, among many other contests, and don't miss the butter sculptures.

2022-08-11.name: Wisconsin State Fair
2022-08-11.summary: The fair in this Milwaukee suburb features big-name musicians, a sea-lion show, a daily parade and lots of contests, including hog-calling, cookie-stacking and             cream puff-eating.

2022-08-11.name: Minnesota Bluegrass & Old-Time Music Festival
2022-08-11.summary: This family-friendly festival includes music             on five stages and workshops at El Rancho Mañana Campground, 20 miles west of St. Cloud.

2022-08-11.name: Tug Fest
2022-08-11.summary: The two towns stretch a 680-pound, 2,400-foot rope across the Mississippi River for the ultimate tug of war. There's also a parade, fireworks, children's games, concerts and carnival rides. Score so far: Illinois 23, Iowa 11.

2022-08-11.name: National Blueberry Festival
2022-08-11.summary: Eat until you're blue in the face during the festival in this Lake Michigan beach town. There's a pie-eating contest, riverfront concerts, an arts fair and a big parade on Saturday.

2022-08-11.name: Sweet Corn Festival
2022-08-11.summary: The festival in this town between Rochelle and La Salle features nearly 50 tons of free buttered corn, live music, a flea market, a carnival and a parade.

2022-08-11.name: Ashley for the Arts music festival
2022-08-11.summary:
This nonprofit festival is in the southwest Wisconsin bluffs, half an hour north of Winona, Minn.

Headliners include a variety of country and rock stars. Thursday admission is free, and Friday-Saturday tickets are $20-$30. In addition to music, there will be an arts fair, children's activities and Saturday fireworks.

2022-08-11.name: Cubs vs. Reds at the Field of Dreams
2022-08-11.summary: The Chicago Cubs will play the Cincinnati Reds at the Field of Dreams movie site in a cornfield near Dubuque.

2022-08-11.name: Grand Marais Music Festival
2022-08-11.summary: In addition to music, there will be food and arts and crafts vendors.

2022-08-12.name: Folklorama
2022-08-12.summary: This Manitoba prairie town celebrates its heritage with pavilions representing 44 nationalities, offering             music, dance and food at many venues.

2022-08-12.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-08-12.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-08-12.name: Iowa State Fair
2022-08-12.summary: See a diaper derby, outhouse races and mullet contest, among many other contests, and don't miss the butter sculptures.

2022-08-12.summary: The fair in this Milwaukee suburb features big-name musicians, a sea-lion show, a daily parade and lots of contests, including hog-calling, cookie-stacking and             cream puff-eating.

2022-08-12.name: Minnesota Bluegrass & Old-Time Music Festival
2022-08-12.summary: This family-friendly festival includes music             on five stages and workshops at El Rancho Mañana Campground, 20 miles west of St. Cloud.

2022-08-12.summary: The festival in this town between Rochelle and La Salle features nearly 50 tons of free buttered corn, live music, a flea market, a carnival and a parade.

Headliners include a variety of country and rock stars. Thursday admission is free, and Friday-Saturday tickets are $20-$30. In addition to music, there will be an arts fair, children's activities and Saturday fireworks.

2022-08-12.name: Grand Portage Powwow & Rendezvous
2022-08-12.summary: Re-enactors from across the continent gather at Grand Portage National Monument for the annual fur-trade rendezvous; next door, the  Grand Portage Band of Lake Superior Chippewa holds a powwow. Reserve lodgings far in advance.

2022-08-12.name: Bayfront Blues Festival
2022-08-12.summary: The annual music fest on the Lake Superior harbor showcases national and regional             acts on three stages.

2022-08-12.name: Irish Fair
2022-08-12.summary: This big heritage fest on the banks of the Mississippi includes Irish  Got Talent and best legs in a kilt contests, hurling demonstrations,  dancing and lots of music.

2022-08-12.name: Quad Cities Balloon Festival
2022-08-12.summary: This festival at the Rock Island County Fairgrounds includes balloon glows, launches, tethered rides and a play area for children.

2022-08-12.name: Shawano Folk Music Festival
2022-08-12.summary: The free, family-friendly festival in this northwoods town includes dance, crafts, children's activities and instruction in Franklin Park.

2022-08-12.name: Michigan Full Moon Fest
2022-08-12.summary: There will be three days of blues music and camping in this village, 10 miles east of South Haven.

2022-08-12.name: Festival of Sail
2022-08-12.summary: This festival features tours and day sails on tall ships that include the Nao Trinidad from Seville, Spain, and the Brig Niagara and Pride of Baltimore II. The world's largest rubber duck also will appear.

2022-08-12.name: Grand Marais Music Festival
2022-08-12.summary: In addition to music, there will be food and arts and crafts vendors.

2022-08-13.name: Folklorama
2022-08-13.summary: This Manitoba prairie town celebrates its heritage with pavilions representing 44 nationalities, offering             music, dance and food at many venues.

2022-08-13.summary: This family-friendly festival includes music             on five stages and workshops at El Rancho Mañana Campground, 20 miles west of St. Cloud.

2022-08-13.name: Tug Fest
2022-08-13.summary: The two towns stretch a 680-pound, 2,400-foot rope across the Mississippi River for the ultimate tug of war. There's also a parade, fireworks, children's games, concerts and carnival rides. Score so far: Illinois 23, Iowa 11.

2022-08-13.name: National Blueberry Festival
2022-08-13.summary: Eat until you're blue in the face during the festival in this Lake Michigan beach town. There's a pie-eating contest, riverfront concerts, an arts fair and a big parade on Saturday.

2022-08-13.name: Sweet Corn Festival
2022-08-13.summary: The festival in this town between Rochelle and La Salle features nearly 50 tons of free buttered corn, live music, a flea market, a carnival and a parade.

2022-08-13.name: Ashley for the Arts music festival
2022-08-13.summary:
This nonprofit festival is in the southwest Wisconsin bluffs, half an hour north of Winona, Minn.

Headliners include a variety of country and rock stars. Thursday admission is free, and Friday-Saturday tickets are $20-$30. In addition to music, there will be an arts fair, children's activities and Saturday fireworks.

2022-08-13.name: Grand Portage Powwow & Rendezvous
2022-08-13.summary: Re-enactors from across the continent gather at Grand Portage National Monument for the annual fur-trade rendezvous; next door, the  Grand Portage Band of Lake Superior Chippewa holds a powwow. Reserve lodgings far in advance.

2022-08-13.name: Bayfront Blues Festival
2022-08-13.summary: The annual music fest on the Lake Superior harbor showcases national and regional             acts on three stages.

2022-08-13.name: Irish Fair
2022-08-13.summary: This big heritage fest on the banks of the Mississippi includes Irish  Got Talent and best legs in a kilt contests, hurling demonstrations,  dancing and lots of music.

2022-08-13.name: Quad Cities Balloon Festival
2022-08-13.summary: This festival at the Rock Island County Fairgrounds includes balloon glows, launches, tethered rides and a play area for children.

2022-08-13.name: Shawano Folk Music Festival
2022-08-13.summary: The free, family-friendly festival in this northwoods town includes dance, crafts, children's activities and instruction in Franklin Park.

2022-08-13.name: Michigan Full Moon Fest
2022-08-13.summary: There will be three days of blues music and camping in this village, 10 miles east of South Haven.

2022-08-13.name: Pure Water Days
2022-08-13.summary: There's a big parade downtown, followed by Riverfest in Allen Park.

2022-08-13.name: Festival of Sail
2022-08-13.summary: This festival features tours and day sails on tall ships that include the Nao Trinidad from Seville, Spain, and the Brig Niagara and Pride of Baltimore II. The world's largest rubber duck also will appear.

2022-08-13.name: Burger Fest
2022-08-13.summary: This town west of Green Bay calls itself Home of the Hamburger, based  on a local 15-year-old who put ground-beef patties in a bun, called  them hamburgers and sold them at the Seymour Fair in 1885.

2022-08-13.name: Grand Marais Music Festival
2022-08-13.summary: In addition to music, there will be food and arts and crafts vendors.

2022-08-13.name: IndiaFest
2022-08-13.summary: On the State Capitol grounds, watch Bollywood dance and a parade of cultures, eat East Indian food, get your hands painted with henna and learn the principles of cricket and yoga.

2022-08-14.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2022-08-14.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Mozart and Schubert as well as gospel, mariachi, choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2022-08-14.name: Iowa State Fair
2022-08-14.summary: See a diaper derby, outhouse races and mullet contest, among many other contests, and don't miss the butter sculptures.

2022-08-14.name: Wisconsin State Fair
2022-08-14.summary: The fair in this Milwaukee suburb features big-name musicians, a sea-lion show, a daily parade and lots of contests, including hog-calling, cookie-stacking and             cream puff-eating.

2022-08-14.name: Minnesota Bluegrass & Old-Time Music Festival
2022-08-14.summary: This family-friendly festival includes music             on five stages and workshops at El Rancho Mañana Campground, 20 miles west of St. Cloud.

2022-08-14.name: National Blueberry Festival
2022-08-14.summary: Eat until you're blue in the face during the festival in this Lake Michigan beach town. There's a pie-eating contest, riverfront concerts, an arts fair and a big parade on Saturday.

2022-08-14.name: Sweet Corn Festival
2022-08-14.summary: The festival in this town between Rochelle and La Salle features nearly 50 tons of free buttered corn, live music, a flea market, a carnival and a parade.

2022-08-17.name: Venetian Festival
2022-08-17.summary: In this southeast Wisconsin vacation area, the festival includes a carnival, arts and crafts fair, firefighter water fight and, on Sunday, a water-ski show followed by a lighted boat parade and fireworks.

2022-08-17.name: Sweet Corn Festival
2022-08-17.summary: A Wednesday-night parade kicks off this festival just north of Madison, and there's also a craft fair, car show, tractor pull, music, carnival rides and, on Saturday and Sunday, literally tons of steamed sweet corn.

2022-08-18.name: Grant Park Music Festival

2022-08-18.name: Irish Fest
2022-08-18.summary: The nation's largest Irish festival features 100 acts on 16 stages, plus children's activities, red hair and freckle contests and demonstrations by Irish dog breeds. In Henry Maier Festival Park.

2022-08-18.name: Ki-Chi-Saga Days
2022-08-18.summary: The fest in this town just north of St. Paul features a skateboard contest, craft fair, Swedish dancers, a pie-eating contest, fireworks Saturday and a parade at 2 p.m. Sunday.

2022-08-18.name: Sweet Corn Festival
2022-08-18.summary: A Wednesday-night parade kicks off this festival just north of Madison, and there's also a craft fair, car show, tractor pull, music, carnival rides and, on Saturday and Sunday, literally tons of steamed sweet corn.

2022-08-19.name: Irish Fest
2022-08-19.summary: The nation's largest Irish festival features 100 acts on 16 stages, plus children's activities, red hair and freckle contests and demonstrations by Irish dog breeds. In Henry Maier Festival Park.

2022-08-19.name: Oronoco Gold Rush
2022-08-19.summary: The antiques show and flea market in this friendly little village just north of Rochester off U.S. 52 includes more than 400 vendors and 1,200 booths. There's also pancakes for breakfast, homemade pie and music.

2022-08-19.name: Big Bull Falls Blues Fest
2022-08-19.summary: Enjoy national and local blues musicians in Fern Island Park. There's a beer garden, of course.

2022-08-19.name: Evanston Art Fest
2022-08-19.summary: This downtown festival features more than 130 juried artists and art demonstrations.

2022-08-19.name: Winnie The Pooh Festival
2022-08-19.summary: The hometown of the famous children's-book bear celebrates with a block party, bounce houses, parades and fireworks.

2022-08-19.name: Ribfest Chicago
2022-08-19.summary: This street festival in the Northcenter neighborhood, on Lincoln Avenue between Irving Park Road and Warner Avenue, features barbecue plus indie, roots, rock and alt country music.

2022-08-19.name: Ki-Chi-Saga Days
2022-08-19.summary: The fest in this town just north of St. Paul features a skateboard contest, craft fair, Swedish dancers, a pie-eating contest, fireworks Saturday and a parade at 2 p.m. Sunday.

2022-08-19.name: Sweet Corn Festival
2022-08-19.summary: A Wednesday-night parade kicks off this festival just north of Madison, and there's also a craft fair, car show, tractor pull, music, carnival rides and, on Saturday and Sunday, literally tons of steamed sweet corn.

2022-08-19.name: Blues, Brews & BBQ
2022-08-19.summary: Listen to the blues and eat barbecued foods in Petersen Park on McCollum Lake.

Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every night in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion.

2022-08-20.summary: Enjoy national and local blues musicians in Fern Island Park. There's a beer garden, of course.

2022-08-20.name: Evanston Art Fest
2022-08-20.summary: This downtown festival features more than 130 juried artists and art demonstrations.

2022-08-20.name: Winnie The Pooh Festival
2022-08-20.summary: The hometown of the famous children's-book bear celebrates with a block party, bounce houses, parades and fireworks.

2022-08-20.name: Air & Water Show
2022-08-20.summary: The annual free show features aerobatics, extreme flying and parachuting off North Avenue Beach.

2022-08-20.name: Soar on the Shore
2022-08-20.summary: Learn about kite-flying from professionals on Lake Michigan's Crescent Beach. There will be giant-kite and stunt shows and crafts and a candy drop for kids.

2022-08-20.name: PastyFest
2022-08-20.summary: The humble miner's lunch — meat and rutabagas in a pocket of pie crust — has inspired this Keweenaw Peninsula festival, which includes such events as a PastyWalk, PastyPoetry contest and, of course, a PastyCook-Off.

2022-08-20.name: Ribfest Chicago
2022-08-20.summary: This street festival in the Northcenter neighborhood, on Lincoln Avenue between Irving Park Road and Warner Avenue, features barbecue plus indie, roots, rock and alt country music.

2022-08-20.name: Ki-Chi-Saga Days
2022-08-20.summary: The fest in this town just north of St. Paul features a skateboard contest, craft fair, Swedish dancers, a pie-eating contest, fireworks Saturday and a parade at 2 p.m. Sunday.

2022-08-20.summary: A Wednesday-night parade kicks off this festival just north of Madison, and there's also a craft fair, car show, tractor pull, music, carnival rides and, on Saturday and Sunday, literally tons of steamed sweet corn.

2022-08-20.name: Blues, Brews & BBQ
2022-08-20.summary: Listen to the blues and eat barbecued foods in Petersen Park on McCollum Lake.

2022-08-20.name: Art & Chalk Fest
2022-08-20.summary: Outside the Museum of Wisconsin Art, there will be chalk-art workshops for kids, artist demonstrations, balloon art, food, a beer garden, and music all day. Museum admission is free.

2022-08-20.name: HarborPark Jazz, Rhythm & Blues Festival
2022-08-20.summary: This free music festival is in the lakefront Celebration Place.

2022-08-25.name: Minnesota State Fair
2022-08-25.summary: Try flights at the Craft Beer Hall, eat food on a stick, listen to free concerts and watch the 2 p.m. daily parade.

2022-08-25.name: Lakes Bluegrass Festival
2022-08-25.summary: This family-friendly festival, just off the Paul Bunyan State Trail, features more than 40 bluegrass shows and free workshops.

2022-08-26.name: Minnesota State Fair
2022-08-26.summary: Try flights at the Craft Beer Hall, eat food on a stick, listen to free concerts and watch the 2 p.m. daily parade.

2022-08-26.name: Lakes Bluegrass Festival
2022-08-26.summary: This family-friendly festival, just off the Paul Bunyan State Trail, features more than 40 bluegrass shows and free workshops.

2022-08-26.name: Potato Days
2022-08-26.summary: This goofy central-Minnesota festival features mashed-potato wrestling, a golden potato hunt, potato car races, peeling and eating contests and a Saturday parade.

2022-08-26.name: Porcupine Mountains Music Festival
2022-08-26.summary: Few settings are more beautiful than Porcupine Mountains Wilderness State Park on Lake Superior; 25 national and regional blues, folk and bluegrass acts perform.

2022-08-26.name: Mexican Fiesta
2022-08-26.summary: Enjoy the best of Mexican culture at the Henry Maier             Festival Park: mariachi, arts and crafts, spicy foods and contests: dance, costume, jalapeno-eating and el grito, or shouting.

2022-08-26.name: Lake Superior Dragon Boat Festival
2022-08-26.summary: The festival on Barker's Island begins Friday with a parade of teams, fireworks and a concert and continues Saturday with races in the harbor and family entertainment.

2022-08-26.name: Artstreet
2022-08-26.summary: Artists, performers and craft and food             stands fill streets downtown near the Fox River.

2022-08-26.name: HarborFest
2022-08-26.summary: This Lake Superior town celebrates with rock and blues music, a classic car and  motorcycle show, a luge run and inflatables for kids.

2022-08-26.name: Milwaukee Oktoberfest
2022-08-26.summary: There will be dachshund racing, stein-hoisting and brat-eating competitions as well as music and dancing at the War Memorial on the lakefront.

2022-08-27.name: Minnesota State Fair
2022-08-27.summary: Try flights at the Craft Beer Hall, eat food on a stick, listen to free concerts and watch the 2 p.m. daily parade.

2022-08-27.name: Lakes Bluegrass Festival
2022-08-27.summary: This family-friendly festival, just off the Paul Bunyan State Trail, features more than 40 bluegrass shows and free workshops.

2022-08-27.name: Crossroads Blues Festival
2022-08-27.summary: Enjoy a day of blues in Lyran Park, with food from local restaurants.

2022-08-27.name: Artstreet
2022-08-27.summary: Artists, performers and craft and food             stands fill streets downtown near the Fox River.

2022-08-27.name: Great River Folk Festival
2022-08-27.summary: This festival in Riverside Park includes children's activities, a traditional arts and crafts fair and music performances and workshops.

2022-08-27.summary: There will be dachshund racing, stein-hoisting and brat-eating competitions as well as music and dancing at the War Memorial on the lakefront.
